titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Virginia Room Cemetery Files, Undated
titlestmt.subtitle: Virginia Room Cemetery Files

publicationstmt.date: © 2017 Fairfax County Public Library. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid created by Ross Landis, November 25, 2017

titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Virginia Room Cemetery Files, Undated
titlepage.subtitle: A Collection in The Fairfax County Public Library

archdesc.runner: Virginia Room, Fairfax County Public Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: The Virginia Room Cemetery Files, Undated
did.abstract: The Virginia Room Cemetery Files consist of over 400 files on Fairfax County cemeteries ranging from private cemeteries to military burials to church cemeteries. The files contain surveys, articles, reports, tombstone transcriptions, and occasionally photographs.
did.origination: Conley, Brian A. and Virginia Room staff

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Room Cemetery Files, Virginia Room, Fairfax County Public Library

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Collection created over a period of years by Virginia Room Historian-Archivist Brian A. Conley and continuously updated by Virginia Room staff.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p:
Chris Barbuschak, November 2017
EAD generated by Ross Landis, 2017

bioghist.head: Historical and Biographical Information
bioghist.p: The Virginia Room Cemetery Files consist of over 400 files on Fairfax County cemeteries ranging from private cemeteries to military burials to church cemeteries. The files are largely the work of former Virginia Room Historian-Archivist Brian Conley who published a report in 1994 entitled “Cemeteries of Fairfax County, Virginia: A Report to the Board of Supervisors” which listed the location, condition and contents of the known private cemeteries located within the county. The files contain surveys, articles, reports, tombstone transcriptions, and occasionally photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Virginia Room Cemetery Files contain over 400 files of cemetery surveys, newspaper clippings, articles, reports, correspondence, transcriptions, and photographs documenting various Fairfax County, Virginia cemeteries.
